title: Payment Portal For Dawn Foods
description: During my co-op at Dawn Foods, I primarily worked with my product design team on creating Figma pages for a new payment portal for customers to be able to make payments through Dawn's own website, instead of using a third-party website.
content:
About the project

This project focused on creating Dawn Foods' own payment portal, my main project during my co-op there.

  1. Developed the French pages for Dawn Foods' custom payment portal, eliminating reliance on a third-party website.
  2. Collaborated with my team to discuss features such as ACH vs. EFT, error messages, credit card information, and user-friendly design.
  3. Designed the project in Figma, ensuring the portal was accessible and intuitive for French-speaking users.
  4. Regularly met with the UX designer to review and refine my work, ensuring alignment with user experience principles.

Project results

At the end of my co-op, the payment portal had significantly improved and we had completely the Figma pages for many aspects of the project.

  • Created a fully functional payment portal with both English and French Figma pages.
  • Enabled users to view payment history, add bank accounts and credit cards, access error pages, and view invoices.
  • Significantly enhanced user experience and transaction efficiency./li>
  • Learned about Figma, including local components and more efficient ways to design files without having to repeat my process.

title: Header Improvement For Dawn Foods
description: Another project I worked on at Dawn Foods, is creating a new sticky header for the company's website when a customer is on a product listing page.
content:
About the project

The idea of the sticky header is for customers to be able to jump to different sections of the product listing page on their mobile instead of having to scroll without knowing the different sections.

  1. Conducted research on other shopping websites such as Amazon and Pinterest to explore the idea of a sticky header on a product listing page.
  2. Started drafting ideas on Figma based on our current product listing page.
  3. Created a header that scrolls from left to right to be able to access the different sections.
  4. The different titles on the header allows the customer to jump to different sections without having to scroll, with the selected section underlined in red.

Project results

The addition of the sticky header was approved by the Product Design team after iterating back and forth between designs and ideas.

  • The addition of the sticky header allows the user to access the different information of a product on their phone without having to scroll too long.
  • This feature also gives a preview of what is on the product page instead of having to keep looking on their mobile.
  • The sticky header improved the ecxperience of our customers who are usually bakery owners who mostly use their mobiles and are looking for a faster chekout process.

title: Filter Improvement For Dawn Foods
description: As part of my co-op, I made suggestions to my team for improvements on the current official website. One of these suggestions included improving the filter products page.
content:
About the project

This project focused on suggesting and implementing improvements to the official Dawn Foods website, particularly enhancing the filter feature for both mobile and desktop platforms.

  1. Reviewed the website, took notes on potential improvements, and identified issues with the filter feature.
  2. Addressed the confusing 'done' buttons to make the filter process more user-friendly.
  3. Ensured customers could see all filter options on mobile by making the feature title sticky, preventing excessive scrolling.
  4. Designed the filter system so that when one feature is open, another one closes, optimizing screen space usage.
  5. Implemented a button on mobile screens that displays 'apply (1) filters' with the specific number of applied filters, helping customers keep track of their selections.

Project results

After discussing with my product design team, and iterating over my figma suggestions, I was able to finalize the filter feature to be implemented on the official website.

  • Improved mobile user experience by making the filter options more accessible and user-friendly.
  • Enhanced customer satisfaction by simplifying the filter process and providing clear feedback on applied filters.
  • Optimized screen space usage with efficient feature toggling and sticky titles.
  • Contributed to a more streamlined and intuitive mobile browsing experience.

title: Tubender Website
description: As part of Generate, a student-led organization at Northeastern, we collaborated with a startup that builds portable tube-bending machines to design their software and branding.
content:
About the project

In collaboration with the startup Tubender, I was part of the software engineering team of 12 members. My role in the project was to code both the official website for tubender as well as work on the front end software when a customer is designing a tube.

  1. To design both the website and the tube making software, I initiated a react project using typescript.
  2. The process consisted of making my coding as efficient as possible and collaborating with the backend engineers to be able to connect the C++ components.
  3. Some features that I learned to code include designing side bars to switch between the tube bends and add new bends.
  4. I also designed the front end for error messages such as restricting the tube length and materials.

Project results

  • Our team delivered the official website for Tubender from start to finish, including creating designs in Figma and coding the website in react.
  • Developed software that allows customers to upload a CAD file or create a custom bend.
  • Enabled users to design a tube directly on the platform.
